page.title: 07The Dairy
page.content: On 27th June 1985 we went to Chaves Dairy. There we met Mr. Tadman who is the milkman in charge. Chaves Dairy started running about 10 years ago in 1975. Mr Tadman has been there for 8 years. He likes his job. He is the boss. He organises the rounds and orders the things they need. Chaves is a little cottage with a big step leading up to the side door. The Dairy has three big refrigerated rooms where the milk is stored. It is kept at 40 degrees fahrenheit. The milkmen are all busy. The work is hard. They work from 3am until 2.30pm. There are nine milk floats. They sell mostly Channel Island milk; silver top and some gold top which is very creamy. Blue top is semi skimmed and red top which is sterilzed They also sell all types of creams.
